stringValue.value: Exports the server location that implements the OVP (OAuth Validation Point) endpoints.
Exports variables that contain OTK configurations that are related to the persistence layer
Returns values from the token database. 'tokentype' can either be 'token' or 'temporary'.
Retrieves long living tokens from the token database.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Looks Up an item associated with key: cacheKey in cache with ID: cacheID and returns it in values, if the item exists.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)
The message to be cached (required, must exist in the preceeding policy context)

stringValue.value: Writes an item to cache with ID: cacheID with key: cacheKey.  If the cache does not exist, one will be created.  If the key exists, the existing item will be overwritten.
Retrieves client values from the persistence layer. To find out how the parameters can by used refer to the OTK API documentation.
Retrieves values about the given client (or client_id) using the input parameters.
Use 'get' to retrieve client values, 'getKey' for client_id values. 'getAll' is only valid in combination with 'Client ID'
Used to define the OTK OAUTH2 Server running profile.
Finds the OAuth 2.0 access_token within the http request header, as http request parameter or uses the given one. If will fail if a token is found at multiple locations.
This assertion returns an error message, http status and content-type value associated with the given 'Error code'.

A value combined with the given error code. If, for example, an API would be identifiedby the values '1234' and the given error code is '111' the exported variable 'error.code' would contain '1234111'
A value associated with a certain error. If that value is unkown it will be replaced with '000' within the output variable 'error.code'
This encapsulated assertion is used to validate JWT as OAuth Token. Customization to the default implementation can be done in the configuration policy #OTK Validate JWT OAuth Token
Exports variables that are required to process OAuth requests.
This encass converts base64 encoded string to base64url encoded string

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Pass if any of the required RESOURCEs are found (true|false)?
Fail if the SCOPE is found (true|false)?
Pass if any of the required SCOPEs are found (true|false)?

stringValue.value: Verifies SCOPE and fails if the requested SCOPE does not match the granted one.
A space separated list of granted/ valid SCOPE values
A space separated list of required SCOPE values
Deletes token from the persistence layer.
Deletes a token from the persistence layer.
Validates a given Bearer token profile access_token.
Generates request MAC using HMAC-SHA1 algorithm
Validates a given MAC token profile access_token.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Fail if this SCOPE was granted?
Disallow retrieving access_token from query string
Pass if any of the required audience are found ?

stringValue.value: Validates an OAuth 2.0 access_token for a request. By default the request will fail if the given access_token has expired or does not match the given configuration.
Time in seconds for which the access_token will not be validated again. Use this value as a compromise between increasing performance and security. A typical value would be '30'
Use this field if no access_token is received through the request message but was issued out-of-band
If set to 'true' the access_token (and the associated refresh_token) will be invalidated after being used once. Default = 'false'
If set to 'true' the assertion fails if the given SCOPE was granted for this access_token
A space separated list of SCOPE values this access_token MUST have been granted for
The content-type of the 'error.msg' if it exists
The client_id for which the access_token was granted
A JSON structure containing the used grant_type, the client_type and values specified in the custom field of the associated client_id
The SCOPE that was granted to the access_token
The user who granted the access_token/ client
This assertion collects path, headers and payload and returns them in a JSON structure.
